etymologies: late 19th century: from Greek tripsis ‘friction’, from tribein ‘to rub’(because it was first obtained by rubbing down the pancreas with glycerine), + -in

definitions: a digestive enzyme that breaks down proteins in the small intestine. It is secreted by the pancreas in an inactive form, trypsinogen.
shortDefinitions: digestive enzyme which breaks down proteins in small intestine, secreted by pancreas as trypsinogen
